What a leader says can make or break their team. 15 phrases I hear high-EQ leaders say often: 1. Mistakes happen; what can we learn? 2. What do you need to be successful? 3. What do you think we should do? 4. Let's work this through together. 5. What challenges are you facing? 6. How can I support your growth? 7. Tell me more about your idea. 8. I appreciate your hard work. 9. How are you really doing? 10. I trust your judgment. 11. Your input matters. 12. I believe in you. 13. You've got this. 14. Let's celebrate 15. Thank you. How you speak and act as a leader sets the tone. ‚ûü Help your team feel valued and heard. ‚ûü Bring energy that lifts those around you. ‚ûü Create a culture where everyone can grow. ‚ûü Show appreciation; it makes a big difference. ‚ûü Care for them; it inspires them to give their best. üóù And always be sincere in what you say. A leader's emotional intelligence benefits everyone. 5 ways to strengthen yours: 1. Build your self-awareness. 2. Learn to pause before reacting. 3. Listen with empathy to understand. 4. Use kind words that help people improve. 5, Deepen trust and connection with your team. Be the leader you needed when you were starting out. What would you add that great leaders say? P.S. Agree?
